research.name: Do Charging Stations Care about Electricity Rates? [Job Market Paper]
research.abstract: This paper examines the relationship between electricity rate plans and EV charging station installations. I match the number of EV charging stations in a zip code area to commercial electricity rate schedules of investor-owned utility companies in the United States from 2015 to 2022. I also simulate electricity bills for each rate schedule that would occur. Then, I use the synthetic control difference-in-differences method and the local projection difference-in-differences method to estimate how newly introduced EV-dedicated electricity tariffs, designed to alleviate the burden of high demand charges, affected electricity bills and EV charging station entries. The results indicate the introduction of EV-dedicated tariffs led to lower electricity demand charges and 1-2 additional charging ports per zip code.
